# Quality Checklist (Condensed & Non-Redundant)

### Testing

* [ ] I manually tested the new behavior (Mandatory)
* [ ] I added or updated automated tests where appropriate
* [ ] All tests (new and existing) pass locally

### Documentation

* [ ] I updated relevant docs (README, user docs) if behavior changed
* [ ] I added or updated docstrings/comments for important functions or non-obvious decisions

### Design Thoughtfulness

* [ ] I thought through the design before coding and aligned on priorities
* [ ] For major changes, I documented or had a brief design discussion
* [ ] Does this PR introduce large design changes? If Yes include link to design discussion (or documentation of any discussion)

### Clarity & Structure

* [ ] Names, structure, and code flow are understandable and consistent
* [ ] Code is concise without sacrificing clarity
* [ ] Responsibilities are properly encapsulated; composition preferred over inheritance

### Maintainability & Future-Proofing

* [ ] This PR is linked to Linear tasks
* [ ] This PR leaves the codebase better than it found it (cleanup included)
* [ ] The design supports future changes (e.g., clear interfaces, replaceable parts, simple initial versions)
* [ ] Removed code smells: unnecessary complexity, duplication, dead code
* [ ] No new errors; no new warnings (strongly justified if introduced)

### Impact on Others

* [ ] The code is readable and considerate for future maintainers
* [ ] I documented any important reasoning or tradeoffs
